title: How can an essay writing service help students? - Quora

response.answer_text: While I was doing my undergrad, I got a part-time gig with the university as a ‘writing assistant’, a free tutoring service offered to the school’s students who needed some help with their academic papers. How I helped depended on what stage of the writing process the student was in when he or she showed up. If they showed up with only the assignment from the prof, then I’d work with the students to see how they might organize the paper into workable chunks, those chunks would become units - paragraphs or sections of the final paper. In other words, we’d work on the ‘outline’. If it was a research paper, I’d talk to the student about the kinds of search words to use to gather info from sources. Sometimes the student would show up with the essay complete or nearly complete. If the organization wasn’t done well before the writing was done, then there was often a lot of rearranging to do, so that the topic sentences aligned with the thesis statement and so forth. As for ‘editing’ a student’s paper, we were not supposed to do that. A lot of the students were second-language students, and when I’d see a grammar error, I’d tap my pencil on it and ask if they could see a problem. If they did, they’d just correct it; if not, I’d (with my sheets of lined paper) do a mini lesson with sample sentences/structures which were similar to the kind of error the student had made, and see if I could get the kid to notice what went wrong with the structure. Anyway, maybe you’re talking specifically about online services, but there are I believe in many universities ‘student writing centres’ where you can book an hour for free with a tutor/writing assistant. I think a lot of students can learn a lot about writing in general from taking advantage of these services. My only advice would be to visit the writing assistant very early in the process, if you can; it will save you time later.
